intro: Coussapoa steyermarkii, commonly known as the Brazilian velvet tamarind, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various animals. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
